relations.target: growth=07339273-n (the gradual beginning or coming forth; \""figurines presage the emergence of sculpture in Greece\"");08455059-n (vegetation that has grown; \""a growth of trees\""; \""the only growth was some salt grass\"");09318244-n (something grown or growing; \""a growth of hair\"");13510240-n ((biology) the process of an individual organism growing organically; a purely biological unfolding of events involved in an organism changing gradually from a simple to a more complex level; \""he proposed an indicator of osseous development in children\"");13511546-n (a progression from simpler to more complex forms; \""the growth of culture\"");13518338-n (a process of becoming larger or longer or more numerous or more important; \""the increase in unemployment\""; \""the growth of population\"");14257556-n ((pathology) an abnormal proliferation of tissue (as in a tumor)

brain=05488747-n (that part of the central nervous system that includes all the higher nervous centers; enclosed within the skull; continuous with the spinal cord);05619057-n (that which is responsible for one's thoughts, feelings, and conscious brain functions; the seat of the faculty of reason; \""his mind wandered\""; \""I couldn't get his words out of my head\"");05625839-n (mental ability; \""he's got plenty of brains but no common sense\"");07668194-n (the brain of certain animals used as meat);10146463-n (someone who has exceptional intellectual ability and originality; \""Mozart was a child genius\""; \""he's smart but he's no Einstein\"");01329702-v (kill by smashing someone's skull);01404330-v (hit on the head

disorder=13996244-n (a disturbance of the peace or of public order);14075885-n (a physical condition in which there is a disturbance of normal functioning; \""the doctor prescribed some medicine for the disorder\""; \""everyone gets stomach upsets from time to time\"");14522846-n (a condition in which things are not in their expected places; \""the files are in complete disorder\"");00277172-v (bring disorder to);01768023-v (disturb in mind or make uneasy or cause to be worried or alarmed; \""She was rather perturbed by the news that her father was seriously ill\""
neurological=02929206-a (of or relating to or used in or practicing neurology; \""neurological evidence\""

senses.definition: A neurological disorder in which the person affected has an abnormally small head due to a failure of brain growth.
